Willow pyre logs may be used during the Shades of Mort'ton minigame to cremate the remains of Loar, Phrin and Riyl shades. They require level 35 Firemaking to light and grant 100 Firemaking experience when used to cremate a shade.

Contents

  • 1 Preparation
  • 2 Creation
  • 3 Use
  • 4 Changes
    • 4.1 Gallery (historical)

Preparation[edit | edit source]

To make willow pyre logs, players must first obtain some sacred oil. Sacred oil may be made during the Shades of Mort'ton minigame or the Shades of Mort'ton quest. To create the oil, players need to purchase normal olive oil from Razmire Keelgan's store in Mort'ton and then help to restore the temple that lies to the north of the town. Once the temple is rebuilt, players may light the altar in the centre of the temple and use their olive oil on the fire. This converts the ordinary olive oil into sacred oil.

Once the sacred oil has been obtained players will need to use three doses of it upon some willow logs. These logs will then become willow pyre logs and grants 12 Firemaking experience.

SMW Subobject for PhrinPrayer level: 1Firemaking level: 35Prayer experience: 46Uses tool: TinderboxIs variant of: Willow pyre logsUses material: Phrin remainsName: Willow pyre logsFiremaking experience: 100Uses facility: Funeral Pyre (Mort'ton)Uses skill: Firemaking, Prayer, , ,

Players may use the pyre logs, along with a set of shade remains (Loar, Phrin or Riyl), on one of the numerous funeral pyres located to the south and to the west of Mort'ton's centre. The pyre can then be lit using a tinderbox, which releases the shade and rewards Firemaking and Prayer experience, as well as some coins or a key. The type of key rewarded solely depends on the type of remains that are cremated, and do not depend on the logs used.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 January 2015
(update)

Creating Pyre logs now provides the same firemaking experience no matter what item you click on first.

11 July 2005
(update)

The item was graphically updated with the release of Farming.

They require level 35 [[Firemaking]] to light and grant 100 Firemaking experience when used to cremate a shade. ==Preparation== To make willow pyre logs, players must first obtain some [[sacred oil]]. Sacred oil may be made during the [[Shades of Mort'ton]] minigame or the [[Shades of Mort'ton]] quest. To create the oil, players need to purchase normal olive oil from [[Razmire Keelgan]]'s store in [[Mort'ton]] and then help to restore the temple that lies to the north of the town. Once the temple is rebuilt, players may light the altar in the centre of the temple and use their olive oil on the fire. This converts the ordinary [[olive oil]] into sacred oil. Once the sacred oil has been obtained players will need to use three doses of it upon some [[willow logs]]. These logs will then become willow pyre logs and grants 12 [[Firemaking]] experience. ==Creation== 3-dose = {{Recipe |skill1 = Firemaking |skill1lvl = 1 |skill1boostable = |skill1exp = 12 |members = Yes |ticks = 0 |mat1 = Willow logs |mat2 = Sacred oil(3) |output1 = Willow pyre logs |output1subtxt = 3-dose oil }} |-| 4-dose = {{Recipe |skill1 = Firemaking |skill1lvl = 1 |skill1boostable = |skill1exp = 16 |members = Yes |ticks = 0 |mat1 = Willow logs |mat2 = Sacred oil(4) |output1 = Willow pyre logs |output1subtxt = 4-dose oil |output2 = Sacred oil(1) |output2subtxt = 4-dose oil }} Note that both of these interactions use up the same amount of [[sacred oil]], but reward different amounts of experience. ==Use== {{Firemaking info |version1 = Loar |version2 = Phrin |version3 = Riyl |name = Willow pyre logs |skill2name = Prayer |skill1lvl = 35 |skill2lvl = 1 |skill1exp = 100 |skill2exp1 = 33.5 |skill2exp2 = 46 |skill2exp3 = 61 |item1 = {{plink|Loar remains}} |item2 = {{plink|Phrin remains}} |item3 = {{plink|Riyl remains}} |type = pyre }} Players may use the pyre logs, along with a set of shade remains ([[Loar remains|Loar]], [[Phrin remains|Phrin]] or [[Riyl remains|Riyl]]), on one of the numerous funeral pyres located to the south and to the west of Mort'ton's centre. The pyre can then be lit using a [[tinderbox]], which releases the shade and rewards [[Firemaking]] and [[Prayer]] experience, as well as some [[coins]] or a key. The type of key rewarded solely depends on the type of remains that are cremated, and do not depend on the logs used. ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 22 January 2015 |update = Zulrah, Bank Space & More |change = Creating Pyre logs now provides the same firemaking experience no matter what item you click on first. }} {{Subject changes |date = 11 July 2005 |update = Farming |change = The item was graphically updated with the release of [[Farming]]. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Willow pyre logs detail (historical).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Willow pyre logs detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Willow pyre logs (historical).png|center]] |[[File:Willow pyre logs.png|center]] |- |18 October 2004 ⁠–
